intro: Alloiatheros lepturoides, commonly known as the slender-leaved alpine aster, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. It has a compact growth habit and is adapted to withstand harsh weather conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its habitat.
